intro: Raphanus albus, commonly known as the white radish, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to eastern Asia and is characterized by its white, fleshy root and green, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. Its root is often cultivated for its crisp texture and mild flavor, while the leaves are also edible. Raphanus albus is a biennial plant, though it is often grown as an annual in agricultural settings.
